newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian rupee eases in mild spurt in dollar demand.
newsitem.headline: Indian rupee eases in mild spurt in dollar demand.

text.p: India's spot rupee slipped mildly to 35.82/83 on Thursday morning from 35.81/82 opening following a mild spurt in dollar demand, dealers said.

"The market must have been square to short," a dealer said. The State Bank of India (SBI) was expected to be out of the market after a proposed strike called off early on Thursday morning, dealers said.
They said SBI was giving wide quotes, showing lack of appetite for dollars on Thursday.
The rupee opened stronger against the forward dollar on easy money market conditions, dealers said.
